title: Publications
body:
Article   Hara, A., and Iwasa, Y. (2020). Autoimmune diseases initiated by pathogen infection: Mathematical modeling, Journal of Theoretical Biology, 498, 110296. https://doi.org/10.1016/j.jtbi.2020.110296
  Hara, A., Iwanami, S., Ito, Y., Miura, T., Nakaoka, S. and Iwami, S. (2019). Revealing uninfected and infected target cell dynamics from peripheral blood data in highly and less pathogenic simian/human immunodeficiency virus infected Rhesus macaque, Journal of Theoretical Biology, 479, 29-36. https://doi.org/10.1016/j.jtbi.2019.07.005
  Hara, A., and Iwasa, Y. (2019). Coupled dynamics of intestinal microbiome and immune system-A mathematical study. Journal of Theoretical Biology, 464, 9-20. https://doi.org/10.1016/j.jtbi.2018.12.021
  Hara, A., and Iwasa, Y. (2017). When is allergen immunotherapy effective? Journal of Theoretical Biology, 425, 23-42. https://doi.org/10.1016/j.jtbi.2017.04.030
  Nakao, M. and Hara, A. (2012). Global existence and decay for some nonlinear second order ordinary differential equations of degenerate type. Scientiae Mathematicae Japonicae. International Society for Mathematical Sciences. 75, No. 1, 95–103 (Scientiae Mathematicae Japonicae Online: e-2012, 129–137). https://doi.org/10.32219/isms.75.1_95
  Presentation Oral Presentation   Hara, A. and Iwasa, Y. Theoretical study of interaction between allergy and intestinal microbiome. 11th Europian Conference on Mathematical and Theoretical Biology. Lisbon, Portugal. July 2018.
  Hara, A. and Iwasa, Y. “Theoretical study of interaction between allergy and intestinal microbiome”. 2018 Annual Meeting of the Society for Mathematical Biology & the Japanese Society for Mathematical Biology. Sydney, Australia. July 2018.
  Hara, A., Iwanami, S., Ito, Y. and Iwami, S., A highly pathogenic simian/human immunodeficiency virus effectively spread during acute infection virus in Rhesus macaque, Innovative Mathematical Modeling For The Analysis Of Infectious Disease Data (IMAID2017). Tokyo, Japan. October 2017.
  Hara, A. and Iwasa, Y. When the allergen immunotherapy is effective? The European Conference on Mathematical and Theoretical Biology. Nottingham, UK. July 2016.
  Poster Presentation   Hara, A. and Satake, A. Why does food intake during resting phase increase fat accumulation? -Mathematical modeling of circadian control on glucose metabolism. Gordon Research Conference/Seminar on Chronobiology, Castelldefels, Spain. June 2019.
  Hara, A. and Iwasa, Y. Theoretical study of interaction between allergy and intestinal microbiome. Academy Colloquium and Masterclass T-Cell Memory: Thinking outside the blood. Amsterdam, The Netherlands. November 2018.
  Hara, A. and Satake, A. Predicting Optimal Schedule of Food Intake by Modeling Circadian Control of Glucose Metabolism. International Symposium on Biological Rhythms. Nagasaki, Japan. October 2018.
  Hara, A. and Iwasa, Y. When is allergen immunotherapy effective?. Keystone Symposia. Estes Park, Colorado, USA. May 2017.
  Grant and Award   JSPS Overseas Challenge Program for Young Researchers (2019 Nov.- 2020 Jan.)
  JSPS Research Fellowship for Young Scientists (2018 Apr. - 2021 Mar.; 18J20316) (2018-2021)
  Kyushu University Female Graduate School Students Awards (2018)
  Metagen Intestinal Design Prize, Leave a Nest Grant (2017)
